intro: Lachnostachys cliftonii, commonly known as Clifton's lily, is a rare and striking plant native to the mountainous regions of southern Africa. It is characterized by its tall, slender stems and clusters of showy, white to pale pink flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves and is often found in rocky or sandy soils. It is adapted to arid conditions and requires well-drained soil to thrive. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
